snippet: Transportation officials decided to suspend the explosive blasts around East 72nd Street each afternoon until Dec. 5 to better contain dust.
abstract: Metropolitan Transportation Authority officials decide to temporarily suspend explosive blasts around Second Avenue subway construction site on East 72nd Street in Manhattan in order to better contain dust; decision is met with mixed reactions from business owners, some of whom express relief and others impatience over the delay in getting the project finished.

headline.main: 2 Views on Subway Project: Delay Work to Clear Air, or Carry On and Profit Sooner
headline.print_headline: 2 Views on Subway Project: Delay Work to Clear Air, or Carry On and Profit Sooner

snippet: In this week's Tech Talk podcast, Tanzina Vega, the Times reporter covering digital advertising, explains how BrightTag's One Click Privacy works for Web surfers. Phil Simon discusses his new book, "The Age of the Platform: How Amazon, Apple, Face...
abstract: In this week's Tech Talk podcast, Tanzina Vega, the Times reporter covering digital advertising, explains how BrightTag's One Click Privacy works for Web surfers. Phil Simon discusses his new book, "The Age of the Platform: How Amazon, Apple, Facebook and Google Have Redefined Business."

headline.main: Tech Talk Podcast: Great Big Privacy Buttons

snippet: The United States Patent and Trademark Office in Alexandria, Va., recently unveiled an exhibit of 30 giant iPhone-like models honoring the inventions of the late Steve Jobs. Each iPhone model displays patents that list Mr. Jobs as inventor or co-i...
abstract: The United States Patent and Trademark Office in Alexandria, Va., recently unveiled an exhibit of 30 giant iPhone-like models honoring the inventions of the late Steve Jobs. Each iPhone model displays patents that list Mr. Jobs as inventor or co-inventor.

snippet: Although Samsung can't entice people to wait in line like Apple fans for a new phone, the company can fight back with advertising. Enter the new sure-to-go-viral video by Samsung: "Why Wait? The Next Big Thing Is Already Here." The ad pokes fun at...
abstract: Although Samsung can't entice people to wait in line like Apple fans for a new phone, the company can fight back with advertising. Enter the new sure-to-go-viral video by Samsung: "Why Wait? The Next Big Thing Is Already Here." The ad pokes fun at Apple while showcasing the Samsung Galaxy S II, a 4G Android phone with a large 4.3-inch screen.

headline.main: Samsung Pokes Fun at Apple in Phone Ad

snippet: Martha Stewart's live Thanksgiving show featured a bevy of interactive and real-time technologies, including questions via Twitter, Facebook and even Google's new social network, Google+. Ms. Stewart said that this year, more than 8,000 questions ...
abstract: Martha Stewart's live Thanksgiving show featured a bevy of interactive and real-time technologies, including questions via Twitter, Facebook and even Google's new social network, Google+. Ms. Stewart said that this year, more than 8,000 questions came in from the Internet.

headline.main: Martha Stewart Goes Social With Her Turkey Hot Line

snippet: Several apps — some free, some costing up to $90 — offer analysis and tips for those who want to make informed bets on N.F.L. games.
abstract: Bob Tedeschi App Smart column highlights apps that offer analysis and tips for those who want to make informed bets on professional football games.

headline.main: Some Tools for the Underdog in the Football Pool
headline.print_headline: Some Tools for the Underdog in the Football Pool

snippet: Cellphone apps allow users to send greetings by e-mail, or create and mail paper cards by phone.
abstract: Highlights presented of smartphone holiday greeting card apps.

snippet: Education publishers are planning for a future where many school books are read online or via a portable electronic device.

headline.main: Textbooks Finally Take a Big Leap to Digital
headline.print_headline: Schoolwork Gets Swept Up in Rush to Go Digital

snippet: Is everyone musical? One sonic pioneer thinks so. And he has the technology to prove it.

headline.main: The Machine That Makes You Musical

snippet: A perfect tailgate party dessert recipe: mini apple pies.
abstract: A perfect tailgate party dessert recipe: mini apple pies.

headline.main: Tailgating Recipes: Mini Mile-High Apple Pies
